intro: Serapias cordigera subsp. lorenziana, commonly known as the Alpine Serapias, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive hooded structure. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it is often found in open, sunny environments. This subspecies is noted for its horticultural value and is appreciated for its vibrant blooms and adaptability to challenging growing conditions.
